availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
A Copy of the Record of the common Council of the City of Henderson Ky.
Mayor's Office May 7th 1861
The City Judge, C. W. Hutchen, handed in his resignation to take effect when a successor shall have been appointed, commissioned and qualified.
On motion of Mr. Ladd, the Resignation is accepted.

On motion of Mr. Matthews, it is ordered by the Mayor and Council of the City of Henderson, that Paul A. Blackwell be and he is hereby appointed Police Judge of the City of Henderson, to fill the vacancy and unexpired term occasioned by the resignation of C. W. Hutchen, all which is ordered to be certified to the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

A true Copy
Attest F. W. Rentlinger
city clerk

figure.ab:
SEAL OF THE CITY OF HENDERSON.
HENDERSON COUNTY KY.

SEAL OF THE CITY OF HENDERSON.
HENDERSON COUNTY KY.

body.p:
Henderson
Police Judge.
P. A. Blackwell
vice
C. W. Hutchen
resigned
Issd. May 17th 1861
